meanings.definition: A short, humorous tale in verse or prose.
meanings.sent1: The children giggled at the silly fabliau their teacher read aloud.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed writing fabliau stories to entertain her friends.
meanings.sent3: The fabliau about the talking animals made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling skills turned a simple fabliau into a captivating adventure.
meanings.sent5: The fabliau was so funny that it became a favorite among the listeners.

meanings.definition: A medieval French tale characterized by bawdy humor and satire.
meanings.sent1: The students studied the historical significance of the fabliau in literature.
meanings.sent2: The fabliau they read in class was filled with witty jokes and clever wordplay.
meanings.sent3: The knights in the fabliau found themselves in hilarious predicaments.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling style brought the old fabliau to life with vivid imagery.
meanings.sent5: The fabliau's humor was so sharp that it left the audience in stitches.
